Articles.Content:
Hi everyone, long time lurker deciding to try and come out of the shadows and become a little more active in the community.

So I thought I'd make my first real endeavor with a spacecraft exchange thread, and so I give to you

The Teufel Vogel series:

Starting with mark 1:

Teufel Vogel 1

With inspiration drawn from the german blue print of the me 262 HG III

Teufel Vogel 1 A

(press picture for more detail on the plane's layout.)

The first prototype in the series, suffers from an incorrect Navigation ball, a tendency to destroy it's tail upon lift-off,

and a tendency to loose control when on operational height.

Stats:

specific thrust: 300.000 kN

fuel load: 1960 L.

TWR: 1.53

Delta-V: 6579/6579m/s

maximum air intake: 0.8

operational range at sealevel:*

turn time: apx. 13.5 sec.

operational hight: apx. 18000 m.

Mods in use:

B9 aerospace package V.2.5

Procedural Dynamics V 0.2

Craft file

Teufel Vogel 1 B

(press picture for more detail on the plane's layout.)

The Second Prototype in the series, this model focuses in on cancelling out the imperfections of the first prototype,

a drone core has been added to correct the navigation ball, tail and landing gear has been modified to mitigate the difficult take-off,

and weight has been shifted around to make a much more stable craft upon height.

stats:

specific thrust: 300.000 kN

fuel load: 1960 L.

TWR: 1.52

Delta-V: 6537/6537m/s

maximum air intake: 0.8

operational range at sealevel:*

turn time: apx. 14.5 sec.

operational hight: apx. 18000 m.

Mods in use:

B9 aerospace package V.2.5

Procedural Dynamics V 0.2

Craft file

another great mod i used to calculate the weight, the TWR, and so on; is the kerbal engineer redux

That is all for now, hope you enjoy the craft, and find it enjoyable.

I have now added some stats to follow the plane and a second prototype, though there are still some things i haven't added yet, in due time these will be added as well.

Edited May 28, 2013 by Manifest
Pretty plane. Did you intend for it to look like an RAF Bucaneer?

Pretty plane. Did you intend for it to look like an RAF Bucaneer?

No, but I can definitely see the resemblance.

It is made with inspiration from this guy right here
Oh, well, yours is an even closer reproduction of that. Nice job.
thanks, means a lot, really, it's always nice to hear someone talk positively about something you made
